questions.question_text: Which of the following DNS records maps an alias to a true name?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. CNAME

A Canonical Name (CNAME) record in DNS maps an alias (or canonical name) to a true name (or canonical name). This allows a domain name to be an alias for another domain name. When a DNS lookup is performed on the alias, the CNAME record redirects the query to the true name specified in the record. This is commonly used for creating aliases for hosts or domains. Therefore, option D, CNAME, is the correct answer.
This question was on the exam

Selected Answer: CD
C. QSFP+
D. Multimode

QSFP+ (Quad Small Form-factor Pluggable Plus) transceivers are designed for high-density, high-speed networking applications such as 40 Gigabit Ethernet. They can support data rates of 40 Gbps, making them suitable for achieving 40GB of network throughput.

Multimode fiber optic cable is often used with QSFP+ transceivers for short-range data transmission, such as within data centers or between buildings in close proximity. Multimode fiber can support the high data rates required for 40GB of network throughput over relatively short distances, typically up to 100 meters, depending on the specific type of multimode fiber used

questions.question_text: Which of the following combinations of single cables and transceivers will allow a server to have 40GB of network throughput? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Assign a new IP address range to the local company.

Given that both companies are currently using overlapping IP address ranges, the most straightforward and effective solution to quickly connect the two companies without causing IP address conflicts would be to reassign a new, non-overlapping IP address range to the local company. This change would ensure that both companies can communicate without any IP address conflicts or the need for complex routing rules to manage the overlap.

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D. Assign a NAT range to the local company.

Network Address Translation (NAT) can be used to map the local company's IP address range to a different range, allowing the two companies to communicate without overlapping IP addresses. This is a quick and effective solution to connect the two companies without needing to reassign IP addresses immediately.

Selected Answer: D
Since the two companies are using overlapping IP address ranges, Network Address Translation (NAT) can be used to quickly resolve the conflict by assigning a unique NAT range to the local company. This allows both networks to communicate without requiring an immediate IP address reconfiguration for the local company. NAT translates the local company’s IP addresses to a unique range that the global company’s network can recognize, enabling connectivity despite the overlapping address space.

questions.question_text:
A global company has acquired a local company. The companies are geographically separate. The IP address ranges for the two companies are as follows:

• Global company: 10.0.0.0/16
• Local company: 10.0.0.0/24

Which of the following can the network engineer do to quickly connect the two companies?

choices.B: Assign an overlapping IP address range to both companies.
choices.A: Assign static routing to advertise the local company's network
choices.C: Assign a new IP address range to the local company.
choices.D: Assign a NAT range to the local company.

discussion.content:
The answer is A. Hosts file
If the other users weren't able to access the site, you could argue it's C. But the problem is specific to this user's environment. Host files can be manually configured to override DNS resolution and if it contains an old entry for that URL, then the user won't be able to access the site because the URL is mapping to incorrect IP address.

Selected Answer: C
Keyword: provided Url is not resolving to the correct IP address

Selected Answer: A
Definitely A, an NS issue would be a problem for everyone.

Selected Answer: A
A is the answer

Selected Answer: A
It's A. Hosts file

Selected Answer: C
NS records play a crucial role in the DNS hierarchy by delegating authority for a domain to specific name servers. They are typically configured by the domain's registrar or hosting provider and are publicly available in the domain's DNS zone file. Incorrect or misconfigured NS records can result in DNS resolution failures and prevent users from accessing a website.

comments.content: Only 1 user has an issue though. The records on the nameserver aren't the issue. Something local or specific is happening here. Host files can cause issues if not setup correctly.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Must be DNS issue

questions.question_text: A user is unable to navigate to a website because the provided URL is not resolving to the correct IP address. Other users are able to navigate to the intended website without issue. Which of the following is most likely causing this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
They actually got it right on this question. The answer is within the question " the best method the technician can use to pass along the exact steps other technicians should follow in case the issue arises again?" That is the definition of the lessons learned document. A guide on how to fix certain issues that were dealt by other technicians in the past!

questions.question_text: A technician completed troubleshooting and was able to fix an issue. Which of the following is the best method the technician can use to pass along the exact steps other technicians should follow in case the issue arises again?

choices.A: Use change management to build a database.
choices.D: Close the ticket and inform the users.
choices.B: Send an email stating that the issue is resolved.
